channel.title: World News Headlines, Latest International News, World Breaking News - Times of India
channel.description: World News: TOI brings the latest world news headlines, Current International breaking news world wide. In depth analysis and top news headlines world wide.

image.title: World News Headlines, Latest International News, World Breaking News - Times of India

item.title: Watch: New Zealand cops show off Bhangra moves in uniform on Auckland streets ahead of Diwali
item.description: New Zealand police officers celebrated Diwali by performing the traditional Punjabi dance, Bhangra, in their uniforms, delighting the community with lively moves under colorful lights. The viral video showcased cultural exchange and harmony, garnering positive reactions from viewers who praised the openness to embracing different cultures and races.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Mexico shootout: 19 gang members dead in Sinaloa, local cartel leader arrested
item.description: A shootout near Culiacan, Sinaloa, killed 19 suspected gang members, with a local cartel leader arrested. Over 30 gunmen attacked soldiers, leading to a deadly exchange. Edwin Antonio 'N', linked to the Sinaloa Cartel, was detained. The incident intensified violence since the arrest of cartel co-founder 'El Mayo' Zambada in July.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: ‘Spotlight is on us’: Eminem introduces Obama at Detroit event
item.description: Eminem energized supporters at a Detroit rally for Kamala Harris and Tim Walz, highlighting the importance of free speech. The event featured speeches by Barack Obama and Michigan officials, aiming to bolster support ahead of the election. Eminem has consistently backed the Democratic Party.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: '...She didn’t pretend to work at McDonalds when it was closed': Obama takes a dig at Trump
item.description: Former President Obama and rapper Eminem endorsed Kamala Harris in Detroit. Obama highlighted Harris's middle-class background and genuine work experience at McDonald's. He contrasted this with Trump's staged McDonald's appearance. Eminem, a Detroit native and Trump critic, supported Harris to galvanize local voters and emphasize her readiness for the presidency.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Trump campaign accuses UK’s Labour Party of 'interference' in US election
item.description: Donald Trump's campaign files an FEC complaint accusing the UK's Labour Party of interfering in the US election by sending members to aid Kamala Harris. The complaint cites potential illegal foreign contributions despite current rules allowing volunteering but not compensated or directed efforts.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Trump vs Harris: Bill Gates quietly enters political arena with $50million donation
item.description: Bill Gates, once avoiding direct political funding, has reportedly given $50 million to Future Forward, supporting Kamala Harris’s presidential campaign. Concerns over a possible second Trump term and its impacts on global health policies drive his secretive yet substantial donation.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: About 140 Rohingya Muslims on wooden boat off Indonesia's coast as residents refuse to let them land
item.description: Around 140 starving Rohingya Muslims, largely women and children, are stranded on a boat off Aceh, Indonesia. Residents refuse their landing due to past unrest. The boat, traveling from Bangladesh, originally carried 216 people. Indonesian police have arrested three for people smuggling.

item.title: 'Crony of Hasina': Bangladesh protesters siege presidential palace demanding his resignation
item.description: Protesters in Bangladesh have besieged the presidential palace, demanding President Mohammed Shahabuddin's resignation. The Anti-discrimination Student Movement led the rally, calling for his removal and a new constitution. The protests, starting in July over job quotas, intensified, leading to Prime Minister Sheikh Hasina's resignation and the establishment of an interim government headed by Nobel Laureate Muhammad Yunus.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: E coli outbreak linked to McDonald's quarter pounders affects multiple states: All you need to know
item.description: An E coli outbreak linked to McDonald's Quarter Pounder hamburgers has affected at least 49 people in ten states, resulting in one death and ten hospitalizations. The CDC suspects slivered onions and beef patties as the contamination sources. McDonald's has responded by removing the implicated items from menus in affected states, and the investigation is ongoing.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Dhaka erupts over demand for president resignation, three students wounded
Elon Musk's $1 million cash sops test limits of US election law
Kamala Harris holds 46%-43% lead amid voter gloom
Putin-UN chief to talk Ukraine in Russia on Thursday: Kremlin
Bangladesh interim government names 'anti-India' activist as envoy to an unspecified mission
'3 minutes are enough': A New Zealand airport wants you to hug goodbye faster
About 140 Rohingya Muslims on wooden boat off Indonesia's coast as residents refuse to let them land
Israel confirms killing of potential Hezbollah successor Hashem Safieddine in October 4 Beirut strike
item.description: Israel confirmed it killed Hashem Safieddine, a high-ranking Hezbollah official set to succeed Hassan Nasrallah, in an airstrike outside Beirut. The strike also eliminated other top Hezbollah commanders, including Ali Hussein Hazima, and targeted Hezbollah's main intelligence headquarters.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Court orders Trump's former attorney Giuliani to turn over luxury item and NY apartment in defamation case. See list of items
item.description: A US federal judge has ordered Rudy Giuliani to surrender his Manhattan apartment, a collectible Mercedes-Benz, and various valuable items to two Georgia election workers he defamed. The ruling follows a $148 million defamation judgment against him for falsely alleging election fraud in the 2020 Presidential elections.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: 'Save democracy, give him the job': Jon Stewart on Donald Trump's McDonald's Visit
item.description: During a campaign stop at a Pennsylvania McDonald's, Jon Stewart criticizes Donald Trump, highlighting the absurdity of his publicity stunts. Stewart mocks Trump's attempt to work the fry counter and laments the media's misdirected outrage, while also poking fun at Trump's remarks about Arnold Palmer.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Teenager arrested after allegedly killing five family members in Seattle suburb
item.description: A 15-year-old boy was detained in connection with the deaths of two adults and three minors in Fall City, near Seattle. The victims, who appear to be family members, succumbed to gunshot wounds. The suspect, held without significant resistance, will appear in court on Tuesday.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk
